meanings.sent1: The decumbent cat napped peacefully in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The tired dog was decumbent on the soft rug.

meanings.definition: Growing along the ground without rooting at the nodes
meanings.sent1: The decumbent vine spread across the field without needing support.
meanings.sent2: The decumbent branches of the plant created a beautiful ground cover.
meanings.sent3: The decumbent ivy seemed to be on a mission to carpet the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: The decumbent roots of the tree reached out like fingers searching for stability.
meanings.sent5: The decumbent stems of the succulent plant looked like a green river flowing on the soil.
